name: British Property Federation
membership:
European Property Federation
European Real Estate Forum
goal: The British Property Federation (BPF) is the voice of property in the UK, representing businesses owning, managing and investing in property. This includes a broad range of businesses, comprising commercial property developers and owners, financial institutions, corporate and local private landlords and those professions that support the industry, including law firms, surveyors and consultants.
interests: Banking and financial services, Climate Action, Digital economy and society, Energy, Environment, Single market, Taxation
euInitiatives:
Financial regulation affecting investors in real estate and those providing capital to those investing in real estate (e.g. AIFMD, EMIR, Solvency II, CRD/CRR, ELTIF, CMU)

Energy efficiency regulation affecting investors in real estate (e.g. EPBD, Circular Economy, EEF)
